bug.author: paulbauriegel
bug.description:
TFLite does not convert a containing a MatMul node. System information
Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): No OS Platform and Distribution: Ubuntu 19.04 64bit TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): source TensorFlow version (use command below): v1.14.0-20-g456fbc0e49 1.14.1 Python version: 3.7.3 Bazel version (if compiling from source): 0.25.2 GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): gcc 8.3.0 CUDA/cuDNN version: None GPU model and memory: not compiled with CUDA support
When trying to convert <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oqWFKYXGwars93QmTgr0hd_dsWec77gJ/view?usp=sharing>this model</denchmark-link> the TFLiteConverter fails with . The matmul operation in general does work, whith the example from: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/27640>#27640</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "tensorflow_matmul_issue.py", line 7, in <module> converter = tf.lite.TFLiteConverter.from_frozen_graph(graph_def_file, input_arrays, output_arrays, input_shapes={"0": [1, 128, 128, 1]}) File "/home/paul/anaconda3/envs/openvino/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/lite/python/lite.py", line 641, in from_frozen_graph sess.graph, output_arrays) File "/home/paul/anaconda3/envs/openvino/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/lite/python/util.py", line 116, in get_tensors_from_tensor_names ",".join(invalid_tensors))) ValueError: Invalid tensors 'MatMul' were found. </denchmark-code>
Describe the expected behavior No error Code to reproduce the issue import tensorflow as tf graph_def_file = "model_lcnn_29v2.pb"
converter = tf.lite.TFLiteConverter.from_frozen_graph(graph_def_file, ["0"], ["MatMul"], input_shapes={"0": [1, 128, 128, 1]}) tflite_model = converter.convert() open("model_lcnn_29v2.tflite", "wb").write(tflite_model)
model

comments.comment: I was able to replicate the issue with TF version 1.14, please find the Gist of <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1U8kKeBAyGtdWgmnCVFaKBS42_QuNpeH1>Colab</denchmark-link> .

I tried to modify the python source code to print all tensorName and find your outputNodeName is not "MatMul", it is named "212/212/MatMul"ã€‚ <denchmark-code># site-packages/tensorflow_core/lite/python/util.py def get_tensors_from_tensor_names(graph, tensor_names): ... tensor_name_to_tensor = {} for op in graph.get_operations(): for tensor in op.values(): # add this to print all TensorName print(get_tensor_name(tensor)) tensor_name_to_tensor[get_tensor_name(tensor)] = tensor
</denchmark-code>
output result is : <denchmark-code>0 ... 212/212/MatMul 212/212 </denchmark-code>
then it's work when replace output array with newname <denchmark-code>converter = tf.lite.TFLiteConverter.from_frozen_graph(graph_def_file, ["0"], ["212/212/MatMul"], input_shapes={"0": [2, 128, 128, 1]}) </denchmark-code>

Reiterating Mycaster's solution. You can view the ops names by using following code snippet as well: import tensorflow as tf gf = tf.GraphDef() gf.ParseFromString(open('model_lcnn_29v2.pb','rb').read()) names = [n.name for n in gf.node] print(names) On inspecting the output we see 212/212/MatMul operation. Closing this issue since correcting the node name fixes the problem. Thanks!

Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? <denchmark-link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaP12TRhd9xSxjXZjcZFNXPGk4kc1-qMdv3gc6bEP90vY1ew/viewform?entry.85265664=Yes&entry.2137816233=31206>Yes</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaP12TRhd9xSxjXZjcZFNXPGk4kc1-qMdv3gc6bEP90vY1ew/viewform?entry.85265664=No&entry.2137816233=31206>No</denchmark-link>
